storyTitle: As Exposure Data Specialist, I want to input property exposure details to achieve comprehensive exposure capture

testCases.title: Validate successful property exposure data submission
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Property exposure data entry form is accessible
Valid supporting documents are prepared (PDF, JPG, PNG format, under size limit)
Database connection is active and PropertyExposure table is available

steps.action: Navigate to property exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields including property type, location, value, usage, and document attachment section clearly visible

steps.action: Enter valid property type (e.g., Commercial Building)
steps.expectedResult: Property type is accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid location details (e.g., 123 Main Street, New York, NY 10001)
steps.expectedResult: Location details are accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid property value (e.g., 1500000)
steps.expectedResult: Property value is accepted, formatted correctly, and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid property usage (e.g., Office Space)
steps.expectedResult: Property usage is accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Click on document attachment button and select valid supporting documents (PDF file, 2MB)
steps.expectedResult: Document is uploaded successfully and file name is displayed in the attachment section

steps.action: Review all entered data for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All entered data is displayed correctly in the form fields

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the confirmation message details
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message displays submission success with reference number or timestamp

postconditions: Property exposure data is saved in PropertyExposure table
Supporting documents are stored securely
User receives confirmation of successful submission
Data is available for review and further processing

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with invalid exposure data
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Property exposure data entry form is accessible
Validation rules are configured for mandatory fields and numeric ranges

steps.action: Navigate to property exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with all mandatory fields marked appropriately

steps.action: Leave property type field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without immediate error (validation on blur or submit)

steps.action: Enter invalid numeric value in property value field (e.g., -50000 or alphabetic characters)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error is displayed indicating invalid numeric value or out of range

steps.action: Leave location field empty
steps.expectedResult: Field remains empty without immediate error

steps.action: Enter property value exceeding maximum allowed range (e.g., 999999999999)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error is displayed indicating value exceeds maximum limit

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and form remains on the same page

steps.action: Verify error messages displayed on the form
steps.expectedResult: Clear error messages are shown for each invalid or empty mandatory field, including property type, location, and property value

steps.action: Verify that no data is saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: No new record is created in PropertyExposure table

postconditions: Form remains in edit mode with validation errors displayed
No data is saved to the database
User can correct errors and resubmit
System maintains data integrity

testCases.title: Test document attachment restrictions
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Property exposure data entry form is accessible
Test files are prepared: oversized file (>10MB), unsupported format (.exe, .zip), and valid files (PDF, JPG, PNG under size limit)
File type and size restrictions are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to property exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with document attachment section visible

steps.action: Click on document attachment button and select a file exceeding size limit (e.g., 15MB PDF)
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the file and displays error message indicating file size exceeds maximum allowed limit

steps.action: Verify the file is not added to the attachment list
steps.expectedResult: File is not displayed in the attachment section and no upload progress is shown

steps.action: Click on document attachment button and select an unsupported file format (e.g., .exe file)
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the file and displays error message indicating unsupported file format

steps.action: Verify the unsupported file is not added to the attachment list
steps.expectedResult: File is not displayed in the attachment section

steps.action: Click on document attachment button and select a valid file (e.g., 2MB PDF)
steps.expectedResult: File is accepted and upload progress is displayed

steps.action: Verify the valid file appears in the attachment list
steps.expectedResult: File name and size are displayed in the attachment section with option to remove

steps.action: Fill in all mandatory property exposure fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All fields are populated without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Verify the valid file is saved with the property exposure data
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation indicates both data and attachment were saved successfully

postconditions: Only valid files within size and format restrictions are saved
Invalid files are rejected with appropriate error messages
Property exposure data with valid attachments is stored in the database
System maintains file upload security and integrity

storyTitle: As Exposure Data Specialist, I want to review and update exposure information to achieve data completeness and accuracy

testCases.title: Validate successful exposure data update
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Existing exposure data record is available in ExposureInformation table
Exposure data edit form is accessible
User has permission to update exposure data

steps.action: Navigate to exposure data review page
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data review page is displayed with list of existing exposure records

steps.action: Select an existing exposure record to edit
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data edit form is displayed with all existing data pre-populated in the respective fields

steps.action: Verify all existing data is correctly displayed in the form
steps.expectedResult: All fields show current values including property type, location, value, and usage

steps.action: Modify property value field with valid updated value (e.g., change from 1500000 to 1750000)
steps.expectedResult: Updated value is accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Modify property usage field with valid updated information (e.g., change from Office Space to Mixed Use)
steps.expectedResult: Updated usage is accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Review all modified fields for accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All updated data is displayed correctly in the form fields

steps.action: Click the Save or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully and response time is under 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Success confirmation message is displayed indicating exposure data has been updated successfully

steps.action: Navigate back to exposure data review page and locate the updated record
steps.expectedResult: Updated record is displayed with the new values for property value and usage

postconditions: Exposure data is updated in ExposureInformation table
Audit log entry is created with update details
Updated data is available for review and further processing
User receives confirmation of successful update

testCases.title: Verify rejection of update with invalid exposure data
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Existing exposure data record is available in ExposureInformation table
Exposure data edit form is accessible
Validation rules are configured for mandatory fields and numeric ranges

steps.action: Navigate to exposure data review page
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data review page is displayed with list of existing exposure records

steps.action: Select an existing exposure record to edit
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data edit form is displayed with all existing data pre-populated

steps.action: Clear the mandatory property type field
steps.expectedResult: Field becomes empty and may show inline validation error on blur

steps.action: Enter invalid numeric value in property value field (e.g., -100000 or text characters)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error is displayed indicating invalid numeric value

steps.action: Clear the mandatory location field
steps.expectedResult: Field becomes empty and may show inline validation error on blur

steps.action: Click the Save or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked and form remains in edit mode

steps.action: Verify error messages are displayed for all invalid fields
steps.expectedResult: Clear error messages are shown for property type (required), property value (invalid), and location (required)

steps.action: Verify no changes are saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: Original data remains unchanged in ExposureInformation table

steps.action: Navigate back to exposure data review page and verify the record
steps.expectedResult: Record displays original values without any updates

postconditions: Form remains in edit mode with validation errors displayed
No data is updated in the database
Original exposure data remains intact
User can correct errors and attempt to save again

testCases.title: Check audit log creation after successful exposure update
preconditions: User is authenticated and authorized as Exposure Data Specialist
Existing exposure data record is available in ExposureInformation table
Audit logging is enabled and functional
User has permission to view audit logs

steps.action: Navigate to exposure data review page
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data review page is displayed with list of existing exposure records

steps.action: Select an existing exposure record to edit and note the current values
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data edit form is displayed with existing data pre-populated

steps.action: Modify property value field with valid updated value (e.g., change from 1500000 to 1800000)
steps.expectedResult: Updated value is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Modify property usage field with valid updated information
steps.expectedResult: Updated usage is accepted without validation errors

steps.action: Click the Save or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Update is processed successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Note the timestamp and confirmation details of the update
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation message includes timestamp or reference number for the update

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs section or access audit logs for the updated exposure record
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is displayed with search or filter options

steps.action: Search for audit log entries related to the updated exposure record using record ID or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry for the update is displayed in the results

steps.action: Verify audit log entry contains update details
steps.expectedResult: Audit log shows user ID, timestamp, record ID, fields modified (property value, property usage), old values, and new values

steps.action: Verify the audit log timestamp matches the update confirmation timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Timestamps are consistent and accurately reflect when the update occurred

postconditions: Exposure data is successfully updated in ExposureInformation table
Complete audit log entry exists with all change details
Audit trail is maintained for compliance and tracking
Audit log is accessible for future reference and reporting

storyTitle: As Exposure Data Specialist, I want to validate exposure data inputs to achieve data accuracy and compliance

testCases.title: Validate acceptance of correct exposure data inputs
preconditions: User is logged in as Exposure Data Specialist
User has access to exposure data entry form
ExposureInformation tables are accessible
API endpoint POST /api/applicants/exposures is available
User has valid applicant record to attach exposure data

steps.action: Navigate to the exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data entry form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible

steps.action: Enter valid exposure type from the dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Exposure type is selected and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid numeric value in the exposure amount field (e.g., 50000)
steps.expectedResult: Numeric value is accepted and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid date in the exposure date field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted in correct format and no validation error is displayed

steps.action: Fill in all remaining mandatory exposure fields with valid data
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept valid data and no validation errors are displayed anywhere on the form

steps.action: Click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is processed successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Verify the exposure data is saved in the system
steps.expectedResult: Data is saved successfully and can be retrieved from ExposureInformation tables

postconditions: Exposure data is stored in ExposureInformation tables
Success confirmation message is displayed to user
Form is cleared or redirected to confirmation page
Audit log records the data entry action

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid exposure data inputs
preconditions: User is logged in as Exposure Data Specialist
User has access to exposure data entry form
Validation rules are configured for mandatory fields and numeric ranges
API endpoint POST /api/applicants/exposures is available
Real-time validation is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data entry form is displayed with all fields empty

steps.action: Leave the mandatory exposure type field empty and move to next field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message is displayed indicating exposure type is required

steps.action: Enter alphabetic characters (e.g., 'ABC') in the numeric exposure amount field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message is displayed indicating numeric value is required

steps.action: Enter a numeric value outside the acceptable range (e.g., -1000 or exceeding maximum limit)
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message is displayed indicating value must be within acceptable range

steps.action: Leave other mandatory fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error messages are displayed for each empty mandatory field

steps.action: Attempt to click the Submit button with validation errors present
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and error summary message is displayed indicating all errors must be corrected

steps.action: Correct all validation errors by entering valid data in all fields
steps.expectedResult: All inline error messages disappear and Submit button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click the Submit button after correcting all errors
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully and confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Invalid data is not saved to ExposureInformation tables
User is informed of all validation errors
Form remains on screen with user-entered data until errors are corrected
After correction, valid data is saved successfully

testCases.title: Test validation for multiple exposure types
preconditions: User is logged in as Exposure Data Specialist
User has access to exposure data entry form
Multiple exposure types are configured in the system (e.g., Property, Liability, Auto, Workers Compensation)
Validation rules are defined for each exposure type
API endpoint POST /api/applicants/exposures is available

steps.action: Navigate to the exposure data entry form
steps.expectedResult: Exposure data entry form is displayed with exposure type dropdown available

steps.action: Select 'Property' exposure type from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Property exposure type is selected and relevant fields for property exposure are displayed

steps.action: Enter valid data for all mandatory property exposure fields
steps.expectedResult: All property exposure fields accept valid data with no validation errors displayed

steps.action: Click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Property exposure data is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate back to exposure data entry form and select 'Liability' exposure type
steps.expectedResult: Liability exposure type is selected and relevant fields for liability exposure are displayed

steps.action: Enter valid data for all mandatory liability exposure fields
steps.expectedResult: All liability exposure fields accept valid data with no validation errors displayed

steps.action: Click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Liability exposure data is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate back to exposure data entry form and select 'Auto' exposure type
steps.expectedResult: Auto exposure type is selected and relevant fields for auto exposure are displayed

steps.action: Enter valid data for all mandatory auto exposure fields
steps.expectedResult: All auto exposure fields accept valid data with no validation errors displayed

steps.action: Click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Auto exposure data is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Verify all submitted exposure records are stored in the system
steps.expectedResult: All three exposure types (Property, Liability, Auto) are successfully saved and retrievable from ExposureInformation tables

postconditions: Multiple exposure type records are stored in ExposureInformation tables
Each exposure type maintains its specific validation rules
All submitted data passes validation for respective exposure types
Success confirmation is displayed for each submission
Audit log records all exposure data entries
